headline: Apple reportedly eyes a budget laptop, Denny's to go private
summary: Some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Tuesday, Nov. 4, include: Apple (AAPL) is preparing to launch a low-cost Mac laptop next year, according to a report from Bloomberg. Papa John's (PZZA) shares are falling following a Reuters report that Apollo Global has pulled its offer to take the pizza chain private. Shares of Denny's (DENN) are soaring after agreeing to go private. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination. Editor's note: Apollo Global Management is the parent company of Yahoo Finance.

content.title: Apple reportedly eyes a budget laptop, Denny's to go private
content.description:
Some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Tuesday, Nov. 4, include:

Apple (AAPL) is preparing to launch a low-cost Mac laptop next year, according to a report from Bloomberg.

Papa John's (PZZA) shares are falling following a Reuters report that Apollo Global has pulled its offer to take the pizza chain private.

Shares of Denny's (DENN) are soaring after agreeing to go private.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

Editor's note: Apollo Global Management is the parent company of Yahoo Finance.

headline: Private-Credit Earnings Ease Investor Concern Over Asset Class’s Health
summary: Shares of  Apollo Global Management  rose around 5% on Tuesday after the private-markets giant reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings.  A day earlier, another firm,  Ares Management  also reported earnings that beat Wall Street expectations, sending its shares up more than 4% that day.  The market reaction suggested that investor concern had diminished in the nearly two weeks since  Blackstone  reported earnings and private-credit fears weighed on its shares.

content.title: Private-Credit Earnings Ease Investor Concern Over Asset Class’s Health
content.summary: Shares of  Apollo Global Management  rose around 5% on Tuesday after the private-markets giant reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings.  A day earlier, another firm,  Ares Management  also reported earnings that beat Wall Street expectations, sending its shares up more than 4% that day.  The market reaction suggested that investor concern had diminished in the nearly two weeks since  Blackstone  reported earnings and private-credit fears weighed on its shares.

headline: ​Papa John’s Drops After Report Says Deal Is Shelved
summary: ​Papa John’s International’s shares tumbled about 10% after a report that a private-equity firm backed off a potential deal to acquire the pizza brand.  Apollo Global Management recently had bid to take Papa John’s private but withdrew that offer about a week ago, Reuters reported Wednesday.  Papa John’s is due to report quarterly results Thursday.

content.title: ​Papa John’s Drops After Report Says Deal Is Shelved
content.summary: ​Papa John’s International’s shares tumbled about 10% after a report that a private-equity firm backed off a potential deal to acquire the pizza brand.  Apollo Global Management recently had bid to take Papa John’s private but withdrew that offer about a week ago, Reuters reported Wednesday.  Papa John’s is due to report quarterly results Thursday.

headline: Papa John’s Stock Tumbles on Report That Apollo Won’t Take Pizza Chain Private
summary: Private-equity firm Apollo reportedly has backtracked on its bid because of concerns of weaker consumer spending on fast food, Reuters reported.

content.title: Papa John’s Stock Tumbles on Report That Apollo Won’t Take Pizza Chain Private
content.summary: Private-equity firm Apollo reportedly has backtracked on its bid because of concerns of weaker consumer spending on fast food, Reuters reported.

headline: Apollo’s Rowan Targets Retail-Focused Firms to Back Private Asset Growth
summary: “This will allow our industry to reach clients we would never on our own reach and who want exposure to private assets, but will not get exposure to private assets directly,” Apollo CEO Marc Rowan told analysts.

content.title: Apollo’s Rowan Targets Retail-Focused Firms to Back Private Asset Growth
content.summary: “This will allow our industry to reach clients we would never on our own reach and who want exposure to private assets, but will not get exposure to private assets directly,” Apollo CEO Marc Rowan told analysts.

headline: Papa John’s shares plunge after Apollo reportedly withdraws takeover bid
summary: Investing.com -- Papa John’s shares are trading nearly 18% lower midday on Tuesday following a Reuters report that Apollo Global withdrew its $64 per share bid to take the pizza chain private.

content.title: Papa John’s shares plunge after Apollo reportedly withdraws takeover bid
content.summary: Investing.com -- Papa John’s shares are trading nearly 18% lower midday on Tuesday following a Reuters report that Apollo Global withdrew its $64 per share bid to take the pizza chain private.

headline: Papa John’s Sinks Most Since 2020 on Report Apollo Pulled Bid
summary: Apollo Global withdrew its offer to take pizza chain Papa John’s private at $64 a share about a week ago, Reuters reported, citing people familiar with the deal.  Papa John’s, which is scheduled to report third-quarter earnings on Thursday, didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.  Analysts polled by Bloomberg expect adjusted earnings to fall 5.2% from a year earlier.

content.title: Papa John’s Sinks Most Since 2020 on Report Apollo Pulled Bid
content.summary: Apollo Global withdrew its offer to take pizza chain Papa John’s private at $64 a share about a week ago, Reuters reported, citing people familiar with the deal.  Papa John’s, which is scheduled to report third-quarter earnings on Thursday, didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.  Analysts polled by Bloomberg expect adjusted earnings to fall 5.2% from a year earlier.

headline: Ørsted sells 50% stake in Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm for $6.5bn
summary: Hornsea 3 is being constructed within Ørsted’s Hornsea zone, alongside the Hornsea 1 and 2 projects.

content.title: Ørsted sells 50% stake in Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm for $6.5bn
content.summary: Hornsea 3 is being constructed within Ørsted’s Hornsea zone, alongside the Hornsea 1 and 2 projects.

thumbnail.caption: The transaction aligns with Ørsted’s capital management strategy and supports its ongoing divestment programme. Credit: ShutterDesigner/Shutterstock.com.

headline: McDonald’s Earnings, Tariff Update, Musk Pay Vote: What to Watch This Week
summary: All eyes are on the government shutdown, which is nearing the longest on record. Meanwhile, investors will dig into earnings from McDonald’s, AMD and others. On Thursday, Tesla is due to publish the outcome of its shareholder vote on CEO Elon Musk’s pay package.

content.title: McDonald’s Earnings, Tariff Update, Musk Pay Vote: What to Watch This Week
content.summary: All eyes are on the government shutdown, which is nearing the longest on record. Meanwhile, investors will dig into earnings from McDonald’s, AMD and others. On Thursday, Tesla is due to publish the outcome of its shareholder vote on CEO Elon Musk’s pay package.

headline: Ørsted Sells 50% of Hornsea 3 Offshore Wind Project to Apollo for $5.6 Billion
summary: Ørsted has agreed to sell a 50% stake in its 2.9 GW Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm to Apollo-managed funds for approximately DKK 39 billion ($5.6 billion).

content.title: Ørsted Sells 50% of Hornsea 3 Offshore Wind Project to Apollo for $5.6 Billion
content.summary: Ørsted has agreed to sell a 50% stake in its 2.9 GW Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm to Apollo-managed funds for approximately DKK 39 billion ($5.6 billion).
